page.title: 02History of St. Albans
page.content: The{Catuvellauni Tribe}made the first settlement in{Prae Wood.}After that the{Romans}had a settlement in the same place. They called it{Verulamium which means marsh land. In{61 AD {Boudicca}burnt down Verulamium. It was burnt down again in{155 AD.}In{209 AD on February 11th{St. Alban}was martyred. The{Domesday Book}tells us that there were 450 people in St. Albans and thousands of pigs. In 1154 AD{Nicholas Breakspeare}became Pope Adrian IV. He was the son of a monk in St. Albans. He was the only English Pope. St. Albans was one of the towns involved in writing the{Magna Carta. {The Black Death}killed off the Abbot of St. Albans. Three leaders of St. Albans were put to death in the {Peasant's Revolt.}A battle of the{Wars {of the Roses}was fought in St. Albans in 1455 AD.
